026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool;
027
028import com.sun.source.util.TreePath;
029import com.sun.tools.javac.code.Flags;
030import com.sun.tools.javac.code.Symbol.*;
031import com.sun.tools.javac.comp.MemberEnter;
032import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.JCTree;
033import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.JCTree.*;
034import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.TreeInfo;
035import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Context;
036import com.sun.tools.javac.util.List;
037
038import static com.sun.tools.javac.code.Flags.*;
039import static com.sun.tools.javac.code.Kinds.Kind.*;
040
041/**
042 * Javadoc's own memberEnter phase does a few things above and beyond that
043 * done by javac.
044 */
045public class JavadocMemberEnter extends MemberEnter {
046    public static JavadocMemberEnter instance0(Context context) {
047        MemberEnter instance = context.get(memberEnterKey);
048        if (instance == null)
049            instance = new JavadocMemberEnter(context);
050        return (JavadocMemberEnter) instance;
051    }
052
053    public static void preRegister(Context context) {
054        context.put(memberEnterKey,
055            (Context.Factory<MemberEnter>) JavadocMemberEnter::new);
056    }
057
058    final ToolEnvironment toolEnv;
059
060    protected JavadocMemberEnter(Context context) {
061        super(context);
062        toolEnv = ToolEnvironment.instance(context);
063    }
064
065    @Override
066    public void visitMethodDef(JCMethodDecl tree) {
067        super.visitMethodDef(tree);
068        MethodSymbol meth = tree.sym;
069        if (meth == null || meth.kind != MTH)
070            return;
071        TreePath treePath
072            = toolEnv.getTreePath(env.toplevel, env.enclClass, tree);
073        // do not add those methods that may be mandated by the spec,
074        // or those that are synthesized, thus if it does not exist in
075        // tree best to let other logic determine the TreePath.
076        if (env.enclClass.defs.contains(tree)) {
077            toolEnv.setElementToTreePath(meth, treePath);
078        }
079        // release resources
080        // handle constructors for record types specially, because of downstream
081        // checks
082        if ((env.enclClass.mods.flags & Flags.RECORD) != 0
083            && TreeInfo.isConstructor(tree)) {
084            tree.body.stats = List.nil();
085        } else {
086            tree.body = null;
087        }
088    }
089
090    @Override
091    public void visitVarDef(JCVariableDecl tree) {
092        if (tree.init != null) {
093            boolean isFinal = (tree.mods.flags & FINAL) != 0
094                || (env.enclClass.mods.flags & INTERFACE) != 0;
095            if (!isFinal || containsNonConstantExpression(tree.init)) {
096                // Avoid unnecessary analysis and release resources.
097                // In particular, remove non-constant expressions
098                // which may trigger Attr.attribClass, since
099                // method bodies are also removed, in visitMethodDef.
100                tree.init = null;
101            }
102        }
103        super.visitVarDef(tree);
104        if (tree.sym != null && tree.sym.kind == VAR
105            && !isParameter(tree.sym)) {
106            toolEnv.setElementToTreePath(tree.sym,
107                toolEnv.getTreePath(env.toplevel, env.enclClass, tree));
108        }
109    }
110
111    private static boolean isParameter(VarSymbol var) {
112        return (var.flags() & Flags.PARAMETER) != 0;
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * Simple analysis of an expression tree to see if it contains tree nodes
117     * for any non-constant expression. This does not include checking references
118     * to other fields which may or may not be constant.
119     */
120    private static boolean containsNonConstantExpression(JCExpression tree) {
121        return new MaybeConstantExpressionScanner()
122            .containsNonConstantExpression(tree);
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * See JLS 15.18, Constant Expression
127     */
128    private static class MaybeConstantExpressionScanner extends JCTree.Visitor {
129        boolean maybeConstantExpr = true;
130
131        public boolean containsNonConstantExpression(JCExpression tree) {
132            scan(tree);
133            return !maybeConstantExpr;
134        }
135
136        public void scan(JCTree tree) {
137            // short circuit scan when end result is definitely false
138            if (maybeConstantExpr && tree != null)
139                tree.accept(this);
140        }
141
142        @Override
143        /** default for any non-overridden visit method. */
144        public void visitTree(JCTree tree) {
145            maybeConstantExpr = false;
146        }
147
148        @Override
149        public void visitBinary(JCBinary tree) {
150            switch (tree.getTag()) {
151            case MUL:
152            case DIV:
153            case MOD:
154            case PLUS:
155            case MINUS:
156            case SL:
157            case SR:
158            case USR:
159            case LT:
160            case LE:
161            case GT:
162            case GE:
163            case EQ:
164            case NE:
165            case BITAND:
166            case BITXOR:
167            case BITOR:
168            case AND:
169            case OR:
170                break;
171            default:
172                maybeConstantExpr = false;
173            }
174        }
175
176        @Override
177        public void visitConditional(JCConditional tree) {
178            scan(tree.cond);
179            scan(tree.truepart);
180            scan(tree.falsepart);
181        }
182
183        @Override
184        public void visitIdent(JCIdent tree) {
185        }
186
187        @Override
188        public void visitLiteral(JCLiteral tree) {
189        }
190
191        @Override
192        public void visitParens(JCParens tree) {
193            scan(tree.expr);
194        }
195
196        @Override
197        public void visitSelect(JCTree.JCFieldAccess tree) {
198            scan(tree.selected);
199        }
200
201        @Override
202        public void visitTypeCast(JCTypeCast tree) {
203            scan(tree.clazz);
204            scan(tree.expr);
205        }
206
207        @Override
208        public void visitTypeIdent(JCPrimitiveTypeTree tree) {
209        }
210
211        @Override
212        public void visitUnary(JCUnary tree) {
213            switch (tree.getTag()) {
214            case POS:
215            case NEG:
216            case COMPL:
217            case NOT:
218                break;
219            default:
220                maybeConstantExpr = false;
221            }
222        }
223    }
224}
